CURIE.$comment: This is a CURIE (compact URI), but the regex here is an approximation, as the real thing is massive. Also the "format": "curie" is custom, so validators will ignore it by default, hence the approximation regex. See: https://www.w3.org/TR/2010/NOTE-curie-20101216/#P_curie

typeBearer.description: An object which is tagged with an @type property to identify its type. Used in locations where extensibility is required.

namespace.description: Object keys are CURIE prefixes, values are URI base values which are (later) concatenated with the part of the CURIE following the colon.

namespaceBearer.description: Definitions for short URI prefixes which can be used in @type, @role properties, etc. The value is either the namespace directly, or the URL of an external namespace document.
namespaceBearer.$comment: Note that this is very much like JSONLD @context. This is intentional, with the aim of keeping close to JSONLD to facilitate using it instead of this later. I didn't use @context to avoid looking too much like JSONLD.
